results.title: Fine and dandy; Things that go bump in the night
results.creator_credit: Maurice Sellar, Robert Sidaway and Rank Film Distributors
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Best of British”.
Fine and dandy illustrates the fame of British costume dramas in all their lavishness. A wonderfully romantic outcome was the main feature of these films which focused on the purity of love, whether the character was a lusty lord or a defenceless maiden. From malevolent spirits to demonic murderers, benevolent ghosts to spooky fortune tellers, British horror films will have you screaming and laughing in turn. Narrated by Sir John Mills.

results.title: Finding Will
results.creator_credit: Kym Levett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: As the keeper of historical artifacts for his family, Kym Levett recently visited the parts of France that were battlefields during the Great War. He took his two sons and his mission is to find the remains of his great, great Uncle Will Cundy who had died fighting during the war. This is a story of the journey to bring Private William Cundy home.

results.title: Finding the way home
results.creator_credit: Julie McDonald and Children's Welfare Association of Victoria
results.brief_description: Foster parents in rural Victoria discuss what it’s like to care for a foster child, covering issues such as selecting a child, financial implications, emotional support, and most importantly, the benefits. Families interviewed include a single mother with children, an older childless couple, and a middle aged couple with their own children. A young man whose lived with a foster family also shares his experience. Worthwhile viewing for anyone considering fostering a child. Supported by the Federal Department of Family and Community Services.

results.title: Finding the balance: Arnhem Land
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Researchers have found that the Alligator Rivers region in Arnhem Land has the richest assortment of wilflife of any comparable area known in Australia. This film documents the scientists that piece together a comprehensive picture of the fauna in this area.

results.title: Finding out
results.creator_credit: George Luger, Eileen Molony and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Discovery and Experience”.
Educational research into the mental processes of young children has confirmed the value of growing emphasis on activity, experience and exploration for primary school children. Designed primarily for parents and students training to be teachers.

results.title: Finding Nemo [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Andrew Stanton, Graham Walters, Pixar Animation Studios and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A beautifully colourful and enchanting computer animated feature about a father clown fish, Marlin, searching the vast ocean near Sydney for his lost son, Nemo. Marlin pairs up with Dory (voice provided by comic Ellen DeGeneres) who suffers short-term memory loss and Nemo finds himself in a fish tank in a dentist’s office. The experiences the father and son have provide the viewer with an action-packed, sometimes fearsome and fun-filled adventure. (Please Note: some scenes may frighten young children)

results.title: Finding Nemo
results.creator_credit: Andrew Stanton, Graham Walters, Walt Disney Pictures and Pixar Animation Studios
results.brief_description: When Nemo, a young clownfish, is unexpectedly carried far from home, his father Marlin, and Dory, a friendly but forgetful regal blue tang fish embark on an epic journey. Features the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem DaFoe, Brad Garrett.
